definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet

sentences.english: Wings to fly away and excercise what's been taught them.
sentences.chinese: 翅膀讓他展翅高飛並且運用所學的知識。

sentences.english: Mr Cole's independent spirit seems to have taken flight in America.
sentences.chinese: 科勒的獨立精神似乎在美國展翅翱翔了。

sentences.english: Mirs the Youth Pre-employment, A symbol of the vigorous development of the cause.
sentences.chinese: 大鵬展翅，象徵着事業的蓬勃發展。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation, is the Spirit in the Dapeng wings.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族，是氣貫長虹的大鵬展翅。

sentences.english: We fly together, leapt to the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 我們攜手展翅高飛，躍上雲端。

sentences.english: "Peng" symbolizes the fly, for the future.
sentences.chinese: “鵬”象徵着展翅高飛，前程似錦。

sentences.english: If I fly, I want the same as the eagle spread its wings.
sentences.chinese: 假如我會飛，我要像雄鷹一樣展翅飛翔。

sentences.english: They will soar on wings like eagles.
Provides information about the Youth Pre-employment Training Programme and the Youth Work Experience and Training Scheme.
sentences.chinese: 提供有關展翅計劃及青少年見習就業計劃的信息。

sentences.english: Her little white hands are fluttering like doves that fly to their dovecots.
sentences.chinese: 她那雙白皙嬌小的手，如正展翅歸巢的鴿子。

sentences.english: Only then, can the group soar high and overcome any difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只有如許，一個組合才能降服重重堅苦，展翅高飛。

sentences.english: Exerting elites are the insurance of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 展翅的精英是民族的保險。

sentences.english: Two of our rarest, and most graceful, butterflies are on the wing this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 本週末有兩個稀有而最優雅的蝴蝶在展翅飛揚。

sentences.english: With wings, a bird soars in the autumn wind.
sentences.chinese: 只要有翼，當秋風吹起，就能展翅上揚，探索碧空。

sentences.english: You are now ready to spread your wings and fly.
sentences.chinese: 你現在已經準備好展翅飛翔了。

sentences.english: "They shall mount up with wings as eagles."(Isa.40:31)

definition: to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
to circle in the air/to soar
to soar/to wheel about in the sky
male eagle/tercel (male falcon used in falconry)
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet
